_description: Signs of Death — 8 or 12 macaronic lines in couplets

BodTan407.First Lines:
Whan þi hed quakyth MementoWhan þi lyppys blakyth
                    Confessio…
BodTan407.Last Lines:
…Whan þi eyne fylmyn libera me domineWhan deth folwyth
                    venite ad iudicem
BodTan407.Editions:
Louis,  Cameron,
                        ed.  
             The Commonplace Book of Robert Reynes of Acle: an edition of Tanner MS
                407.
         New York: Garland, 1980: 245.

CULEe435a.First Lines:
Whan thy hed quakes mementowhen they thy leppes blakes
                        conffessiowhan they breyt pantys contreciowhan they
                    weynde wantys satisfaxio…
CULEe435a.Last Lines:
…Whan they eyen holowyt nesse te ipsumffor than deth
                    folwes vene
ad Iudecium
CULEe435a.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 19-20.

CULFf548.First Lines:
When þi hed whaketh mementoWhen þi lippys blaken
                        confessio…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…When þine een holoen nosce teipsumffor then the
                    deth folowes veni ad iudicium
CULFf548.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 19-20.
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 100.

CamQue13.First Lines:
When thy hede quakyth momentoThen thy lyppys blakyth
                        confessio…
CamQue13.Last Lines:
…When thy nyen hollyth libera me domineThen deth
                    folowyth veni ad Iudicium
CamQue13.Attributed Title:
Memorare Nouissima & iueteruum non peccavis Ecc. 7o
                    (f. 64)
CamQue13.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of the Western Manuscripts in the Library of
                Clare College, Cambridge.
         Cambridge: at the UP, 1905: 15.
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 19-20.
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 82.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Signs of Death in Middle English.” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         32 (1970): 282-98: 293.

CamTCC1157.First Lines:
Whan thyne heed shaketh mementoWhan thi lippes quakyth
                        Confessio…
CamTCC1157.Last Lines:
…Whan thi eighen holoweth libera me amenThan deth
                    foloweth venite ad iudicium
CamTCC1157.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 19-20.

BLRoy8Cxii.First Lines:
When thy hede qwakes mementoWhen þi lippes blakes
                    confeccio…
BLRoy8Cxii.Last Lines:
…When þi Eyen holowyth nosso te ipsumffor þen dethe
                    folowythe nota Iudicum

Longleat29.First Lines:
When þi hede quakes MementoAnd þy lippis Blakes
                        Confessio…
Longleat29.Last Lines:
…When þyn eyȝen holeweth Noste te ipsumffor
                    þan deth foleweth veni ad Iudicum
Longleat29.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Signs of Death in Middle English.” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         32 (1970): 282-98: 293.
